benchmark_details.name: SimpleQA
benchmark_details.overview: SimpleQA is a benchmark that evaluates the ability of language models to answer short, fact-seeking questions. It contains 4,326 short, fact-seeking questions that are adversarially collected against GPT-4 responses, with each answer graded as correct, incorrect, or not attempted.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To measure the factuality of frontier language models through a targeted evaluation of their ability to answer short, fact-seeking questions.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: SimpleQA only measures factuality under the constrained setting of short, fact-seeking queries with a single, verifiable answer.

data.source: Data was created by AI trainers who generated question and answer pairs, with answers verified by another AI trainer.
data.annotation: Questions were created by AI trainers and answers verified by independent AI trainers.

methodology.calculation: The F-score is computed as the harmonic mean of overall correct and correct given attempted.
methodology.interpretation: A model that gets many questions correct while attempting those it is confident about would indicate ideal behavior.
methodology.baseline_results: Various OpenAI and Anthropic models were evaluated on SimpleQA, with GPT-4 showing different scores based on its configurations.
methodology.validation: Performance metrics were manually validated against a set of test answers.
